images.caption: Figure 1:Abstracting and simplifying human research community as an agent-data graph,i.e.community graph. An agent-data graph has researchers as agent nodes and blogs, codebases, and papers as data nodes. Without loss of generality, we abstract it into a simplified version with only researcher and paper nodes and focus on critical research tasks including paper reading, paper writing, and review writing. Each data node has a hidden statehusubscript‚Ñéùë¢h_{u}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_u end_POSTSUBSCRIPTand each agent node is paired with an agent functionfv‚Å¢(‚ãÖ)subscriptùëìùë£‚ãÖf_{v}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ‚ãÖ )and a hidden statehvsubscript‚Ñéùë£h_{v}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Figure 2:ResearchTownsimulation as TextGNN inference on the community graph. We consider the process of adding a non-existent paper node into the community graph including three stages: paper reading to insert agent nodes, paper writing to insert data nodes, and review writing for deciding whether to drop generated nodes or not.
Figure 3:Similarity score distribution for paper writing simulation of 100 high-impact papers.
Figure 3:Similarity score distribution for paper writing simulation of 100 high-impact papers.
Figure 4:Ablation study on the number of cited papers involved in paper writing simulation.
Figure 5:Ablation study on the number of researchers involved in paper writing simulation.
Figure 5:Ablation study on the number of researchers involved in paper writing simulation.
Figure 6:Ablation study on the number of reviewers involved in review writing simulation.

Figure 7:Examples of generated interdisciplinary research papers fromResearchTown. For each example, we includeResearchTown‚Äôs responses to two questions: ‚ÄúWhat is the problem?‚Äù and ‚ÄúWhat are the key components of my approach and results?‚Äù as these are the most critical among the five questions mentioned in Section ¬ß6. Appendix ¬ßHprovides the full contents of the above two and more examples for interdisciplinary research.
